DataElement.preferredName: University of Washington Quality of Life Questionnaire Most Important Issues Past 7 Days How Much Pain and Medication Use 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated perception of the amount of pain they have experienced and the need for medication in the past seven days, using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: University of Washington Quality of Life Questionnaire Most Important Issues Past 7 Days How Much Pain
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed to assess health-related quality of life in head and neck cancer patients._A question about a person's most important health issues._The most recent week, including today._How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number._The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.

ObjectClass.preferredName: University of Washington Quality of Life Scale, Version 4
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed to assess health-related quality of life in head and neck cancer patients.

Concepts.longName: University of Washington Quality of Life Scale, Version 4
Concepts.definition: A questionnaire designed to assess health-related quality of life in head and neck cancer patients.

Property.preferredName: Most Important Issue Past Week Quantity Pain
Property.preferredDefinition: A question about a person's most important health issues.:The most recent week, including today.:How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.:The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.

Concepts.definition: A question about a person's most important health issues.
The most recent week. May include the present day.
How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.
The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: UWQoLv4:University of Washington Quality of Life Scale, Rogers S.N., and Lowe D., Version 4, 1999
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for NRG study in Rave per request by V.Patel. mc 5/16/14

ValueDomain.preferredName: Pain and Medication Use 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard of five responses from no pain to severe pain not controlled by medication.

PermissibleValues.value: I have severe pain, not controlled by medication.
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Have Severe Pain Not Controlled By Medication

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Have Severe Pain Not Controlled By Medication
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has severe pain that is not controlled by medication.

Concepts.longName: Have Severe Pain Not Controlled By Medication
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has severe pain that is not controlled by medication.

PermissibleValues.value: I have severe pain controlled only by narcotics.
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Have Severe Pain Controlled Only By Narcotics

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Have Severe Pain Controlled Only By Narcotics
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has severe pain that is only controlled by narcotic medications.

Concepts.longName: Have Severe Pain Controlled Only By Narcotics
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has severe pain that is only controlled by narcotic medications.

PermissibleValues.value: I have moderate pain - requires regular medication (codeine or nonnarcotic).
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Have Moderate Pain that Requires Medication

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Have Moderate Pain that Requires Medication
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has moderate pain that requires medication to control.

Concepts.longName: Have Moderate Pain that Requires Medication
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has moderate pain that requires medication to control.

PermissibleValues.value: There is mild pain not needing medication.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has mild pain, but that it does not require medication.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has mild pain, but that it does not require medication.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had no pain or discomfort.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had no pain or discomfort.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
